input_description.intro:
This program computes the transmittance of a system and/or its complex band structure. It is controlled through the following variables in the namelist inputcond.
Structure of the input data: ============================
&INPUTCOND ... /

var.name: outdir
var.info: temporary directory (as in PWscf)

var.name: prefixt
var.info: prefix for the file (as in PWscf) containing all the regions (left lead + scatt. reg. + right lead)

var.name: prefixl
var.info: prefix for the file containing only the left lead

var.name: prefixs
var.info: prefix for the file containing the scattering region

var.name: prefixr
var.info: prefix for the file containing only the right lead

var.name: tran_prefix
var.info: if tran_prefix is specified the program will save partial results of a transmission calculation (ikind .GE. 1) in a specific directory (outdir/tran_prefix.cond_save)

var.name: max_seconds
var.default: 1.D+7, or 150 days, i.e. no time limit
var.info: jobs stops after max_seconds elapsed time (wallclock time). It can be enabled only if tran_prefix is specified.

var.name: recover
var.info: restarts a previously interrupted transmission calculation (only if tran_prefix was specified). It can also be used to gather partial results from a calculation that was split by using start_e,last_e and/or start_k,last_k (see corresponding keywords).

var.name: band_file
var.info: file on which the complex bands are saved

var.name: tran_file
var.info: file where the transmission is written

var.name: save_file
var.info: file where the data necessary for PWCOND are written so that no prefix files of PW are longer needed

var.name: fil_loc
var.info: file on/from which the 2D eigenvalue problem data are saved/read

var.name: lwrite_cond
var.info: if .t. save the data necessary for PWCOND in save_file

var.name: loop_ek
var.info: if .t. the energy loop is outside the k-point loop

var.name: lread_cond
var.info: if .t. read the data necessary for PWCOND from save_file

var.name: lwrite_loc
var.info: if .t. save 2D eigenvalue problem result in fil_loc

var.name: lread_loc
var.info: if .t. read 2D eigenvalue problem result from fil_loc

var.name: ikind
var.info:
The kind of conductance calculation:
ikind=0 - just complex band structure (CBS) calculation
ikind=1 - conductance calculation with identical left and right leads
ikind=2 - conductance calculation with different left and right leads

var.name: iofspin
var.info: spin index for which the calculations are performed

var.name: tk_plot
var.info: if > 0, plot T(kx,ky) at each energy in the region [tk_plot x full BZ]

var.name: llocal
var.info: if .t. calculations are done with only local part of PP

var.name: bdl
var.info: right boundary of the left lead (left one is supposed to be at 0) (in units of lattice parameter "alat" defined in the scf run)

var.name: bds
var.info: right boundary of the scatt. reg. (left one is at 0 if prefixs is used and = bdl if prefixt is used) (in units of lattice parameter "alat" defined in the scf run)

var.name: bdr
var.info: right boundary of the right lead (left one is at 0 if prefixr is used and = bds if prefixt is used) (in units of lattice parameter "alat" defined in the scf run)

var.name: nz1
var.info: the number of subslabs in the slab (to calculate integrals)

var.name: energy0
var.info: initial energy

var.name: denergy
var.info: energy step (if denergy=0.0 the energy is read from the list)

var.name: nenergy
var.info:
number of energies
WARNING: the energy in input file is given in eV taken from Ef, and denergy should be negative

var.name: start_e
var.info:
if start_e > 1, the scattering problem is solved only for those energies with index between start_e and last_e in the energy list.
NOTE: start_e <= last_e and start_e <= nenergy must be satisfied

var.name: last_e
var.info: index of the last energy to be computed. If last_e > nenergy, then last_e will be automatically set to nenergy.

var.name: start_k
var.info:
if start_k > 1, the scattering problem is solved only for those k-points with index between start_k and last_k in the k-point list. In order to recover the full transmission (i.e. integrated over the full Brillouin Zone) at the end, perform the partial runs specifying a value for tran_prefix (the restart directory), then put all the partial transmission files 'transmission_k#_e#' inside a unique restart directory and run pwcond.x with recover=.TRUE. (without specifying any value for start_k and last_k).
NOTE: start_k <= last_k must be satisfied and start_k must also not be greater than the actual number of k-point in the list (if you compute the grid automatically by specifying the grid size and shifts, you can use kpoints.x to check that number).

var.name: last_k
var.info: index of the last k-point to be computed. If last_k is bigger than the actual number of points in the list, then it will be set to that number.

var.name: ecut2d
var.info: 2-D cutoff

var.name: ewind
var.info: the energy window for reduction of 2D plane wave basis set (in XY)

var.name: epsproj
var.info: accuracy of 2D basis set reduction

var.name: orbj_in
var.info: the initial orbital for projecting the transmission

var.name: orbj_fin
var.info: the final orbital for projecting the transmission

var.name: nkpts
var.info: Number of k_\perp points

var.name: nenergy
var.info: number of energy points
